modules.description: Implements correctly-rounded floating-point mathematical operations for trigonometric, hyperbolic, exponential, and logarithmic functions. Works directly with float values to ensure precise results for critical computations. Useful for numerical analysis, scientific simulations, and financial calculations requiring strict rounding behavior.

This module implements correctly-rounded floating-point mathematical operations including exponential, logarithmic, trigonometric, and hyperbolic functions. It operates on `float` values and ensures accurate results even in edge cases near zero or involving π-scaled inputs. Concrete use cases include scientific computations requiring precise rounding, such as numerical analysis, signal processing, and mathematical modeling.

This module implements correctly-rounded floating-point mathematical operations including exponential, logarithmic, trigonometric, and hyperbolic functions. It operates on `float` values and ensures accurate results even for edge cases near zero or involving π-scaled inputs. Concrete use cases include precise numerical computations in scientific simulations, financial calculations, and low-level system modeling where correct rounding is critical.

This module provides a set of elementary mathematical functions for floating-point numbers, including exponential, logarithmic, trigonometric, and hyperbolic operations. It supports precise calculations near critical points, such as with `expm1` and `log1p`, and includes variants scaled by π for trigonometric functions. These functions are suitable for scientific computing and numerical analysis where accuracy and correct rounding are essential.

This module enables correctly-rounded floating-point computations with precise handling of edge cases near zero and π-scaled inputs. It offers core mathematical operations—exponential, logarithmic, trigonometric, and hyperbolic functions—along with exponentiation and base-10 logarithms, all supporting controlled rounding modes like `RoundDown` and `RoundUp`. Submodules extend these capabilities to specialized numerical tasks such as `expm1` and `log1p`, enabling accurate calculations in scientific simulations, financial modeling, and low-level system analysis where IEEE 754 compliance is essential. Direct use cases include signal processing, mathematical modeling, and any domain requiring strict numerical accuracy in floating-point arithmetic.
